Package ClientSideHelpers

Class SocketConnect

java.lang.Object
ClientSideHelpers.SocketConnect
public class SocketConnect
extends java.lang.Object
A class that helps send signals without all the needed repetition of code Uses similar syntax to the normal way to make it easy to understand

  • Constructor Details

    • SocketConnect

      public SocketConnect() throws java.io.IOException
      The constructor that sets up a connection the server for a signal to be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throws an exception if the file cannot be found ./db.props

  • Method Details

    • writeObject

      public void writeObject​(java.lang.Object[] obj) throws java.io.IOException
      Send the object from the client to the server
      Parameters:
      obj - the current object to be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the object cannot be sent across the socket connection

    • readObject

      public java.lang.Object readObject() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Gets the signal being sent and stores it for the client
      Returns:
      the object being sent by the server
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the signal cannot be received by the socket connection
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - used for when converting the object into a List (will never occur)

    • close

      public void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Closes the connection
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is an error closing any connections
